title: American_Top_40_1980_December_6th
description:
"Every week we count down the most popular songs in the USA from Utopia, Texas, to Paradise in six different states, and from Xanadu, the soundtrack that is, here are Olivia Newton-John and Cliff Richard with 'Suddenly' at number 30."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

Casey answers the question, "What has been the biggest remake in the rock era?" It turns out to be a song which was actually recorded before the first hit version. Casey clears up the confusion.

From 1970 to 1980, only two artists have been able to put a hit in the top 40 every year. One is Paul McCartney. Casey spotlights the other.

In honor of "De Do Do Do De Da Da Da" (by The Police at number 19), Casey says the AT40 staff has found 54 songs that have hit the top 40 in the rock era with nonsensical titles, and names a few.

In the entire rock era, only seven people have managed to hit the top 40 more than 40 times. There is one woman among them, and she has a song in this countdown. Casey gives the details.

LW#3: The Wanderer - Donna Summer
LW#2: Woman In Love - Barbra Streisand
LW#1: Lady - Kenny Rogers
